description: Tired of infographics? How about a Mathographic? We dive deep into correlation analysis here on SEOmoz, so I thought it might be a good time to review the basics.
content: Correlation vs. Causation (A Mathographic) SEO Analytics By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers September 21, 2011 Table of Contents Copied! By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers September 21, 2011 Correlation vs. Causation (A Mathographic) SEO Analytics As part of our quest to understand the Algorithm, we do a lot of correlation analysis here at SEOmoz. We tend to dive right into the deep end, so I thought it might be a good time to take a step back and talk about the absolute basics of correlation, including some warnings about causation. We’ll often say (and hear) the fallback phrase – “correlation does not imply causation”, but people rarely dig into what that means. To make this experience as pleasant as possible for the math-phobic, I drew you a picture. I’d like to introduce the world’s first Mathographic. Ok, it’s probably not the world’s first, and it’s really just an infographic, but give a guy credit for trying to keep you entertained. View Full-sized Infographic (796 x 2200) Embed this image: <div style="width:604px;"><div><a target="_blank" href="https://moz.com/blog/correlation-vs-causation-mathographic" ><img width="600" height="1658" alt="Correlation vs. Causation (A Mathographic)" src="https://moz.com/img_uploads/correlation-vs-causation-sm.gif" style="border: #cccccc 1px solid; padding: 1px;" /></a></div><div style="text-align:right; font-size:11px; margin-right: 5px;">Created by <a href="https://moz.com/blog/correlation-vs-causation-mathographic" >SEOmoz</a> (Copyright ©2011).</div></div> Obviously, our actual studies get a lot more complex than this, but everything has to start somewhere. If you’re interested in more advanced topics on correlation, here are a few references worth checking out: Correlation and Dependence (Wikipedia) Stastistical Signifcance of Correlations (SUNY) Spearman’s Rank Correlation (U. Delaware) Non-linear Regression (Graphpad) Some Correlation Humor (xkcd) Are there any other correlation-related topics you’d like to hear more about on the blog?
